isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES43-5 AND ES53-5 - DISASSEMBLY - CASE AND SHIFT FORKS

figure.caption: Figure 4. Case and Shift Forks Exploded View

step1.para: After removing the unit from the vehicle ( Figure 5), let the transmission cool down before draining the fluid. This will help protect you against possible burns.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Transmission

step1.para: Remove the interlock ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Interlock

step1.para: Remove the interlock retaining plate and gasket ( Figure 7). The two drive pins securing this plate are required during initial manufacturing only, not for service rebuilds.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Interlock Retaining Plate and Gasket

step1.para: Remove the three poppet springs and poppets ( Figure 8). If they are worn or damaged, replace them during reassembly.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Poppet Springs and Poppets

step1.para: If the poppet inserts are chipped, elongated, or damaged in any way, replace them ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Poppet Inserts

step1.para: Remove the backup light switch ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Backup Light Switch

step1.para: Using a chain hoist, stand the transmission on a suitable workbench ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Place Transmission on Suitable Workbench

step1.para: Remove the nut, washer, and end fitting ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Remove End Fitting

step1.para: Remove the rear shift bar support cap ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Remove Rear Shift Bar Support Cap

step1.para: Remove the rear bearing cap, gasket, and speedometer gear ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Remove Rear Bearing Cap, Gasket and Speedometer Gear

step1.para: Remove the rear countershaft bearing cap and shims ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Remove Rear Countershaft Bearing Cap and Shims

step1.para: Remove the PTO opening cover and use a pry bar to gently lift up on the countershaft gear ( Figure 16). This will make the next step easier.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Remove PTO Opening Cover

step1.para: Wearing safety glasses, continue by removing the output bearing snap ring ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Remove Output Bearing Snap Ring

warning.para: Wear safety glasses to prevent possible personal injury from flying metal pieces.

step1.para: Use either a puller or pry bars in the snap ring groove to remove the output bearing ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Output Bearing

caution.para: Do not pry on the top of the countershaft. If you do, it will damage the countershaft bearing race.

step1.para: Insert a 3/8" bolt with a prying fixture into the reverse idler shaft ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Insert Prying Fixture into Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para:
Remove the reverse idler shaft ( Figure 20). Puller ZTSE-4324 is recommended. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS
.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Remove Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the clutch housing-to-case bolts. Then use your finger or a screwdriver to move the reverse idler gear to the side of the case ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Move Reverse Idler Gear to Side of Case

step1.para: Use pry bars in the milled case slots to break the housing seal ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Break Housing Seal

step1.para: Using a chain hoist, remove the case from the clutch housing ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Case From Clutch Housing

caution.para: Be careful when lifting the case. The reverse idler gear rests loosely on a ledge in the housing and could fall out.

step1.para: Remove the reverse idler gear from the case. Remove the two caged needle bearings and the spacer from the gear ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove Reverse Idler Gear

step1.para: Remove the rear countershaft bearing race ( Figure 25). The easiest way to do this is to tap it out from the inside of the case. Use a brass punch.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Rear Countershaft Bearing Race

step1.para: Remove the rear shift bar support bracket ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Rear Shift Bar Support Bracket

step1.para: Remove the thrust washer, reverse gear, and bearing ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Remove Thrust Washer, Reverse Gear, and Bearing

step1.para: Remove the 1st-reverse clutch gear and shift fork assembly ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Remove 1st-Reverse Clutch Gear and Shift Fork Assembly

step1.para: Use a lifting fixture and chain hoist to lift the mainshaft subassembly from the 4th-5th speed synchronizer ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Lift Mainshaft Subassembly From 4th-5th Speed Synchronizers

step1.para: Remove the countershaft subassembly using a chain hoist ( Figure 30)

figure.caption: Figure 30. Remove Countershaft Subassembly

step1.para: Remove snap ring, then press the gears off the countershaft, starting with the drive gear ( Figure 31). The countershaft uses rolled involute splines instead of woodruff keys to secure the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 31. Press Gears Off Countershaft

warning.para: Any time you use a press, consider placing a shield between you and the press.

step1.para: Remove the 4th-5th speed synchronizer and shift fork assembly ( Figure 32). The front shift bar support bracket and the front countershaft bearing race can stay in the case unless they are damaged and need to be replaced. Replace the front countershaft bearing race if the bearing cone is replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 32. Remove 4th-5th Speed Synchronizer and Shift Fork Assembly

step1.para: Remove the input shaft bearing cap ( Figure 33). If it sticks, tap on the side of the cap with a rubber mallet to loosen it.

figure.caption: Figure 33. Remove Input Shaft Bearing Cap

step1.para: Remove the input shaft by tapping it with a rubber mallet ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Input Shaft

step1.para: Wearing safety glasses, remove the oil slinger and snap ring ( Figure 35). Then press the shaft through the bearing. Case disassembly is now complete.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Remove Oil Slinger and Snap Ring

warning.para: Wear safety glasses to prevent possible personal injury from flying metal pieces.
